editorialSummary.text: Elegant Beaux-Arts building, made famous in film and literature, with upscale casino & performances.

text.text:
Wonderful casino, 100% worth the visit during the quiet season! Too many tourists during the summer however at winter the building can be seen more up close and personal with multiple nice cars and nice weather even into the winter months

Worth the visit, looks great from all angles and the cool cars that drive around the casino is the cherry on top

originalText.text:
Wonderful casino, 100% worth the visit during the quiet season! Too many tourists during the summer however at winter the building can be seen more up close and personal with multiple nice cars and nice weather even into the winter months

Worth the visit, looks great from all angles and the cool cars that drive around the casino is the cherry on top

text.text:
The casino experience was exceptional. The bustling atmosphere, combined with the elegant architecture, created a truly enchanting ambiance.
You can have endless enjoyment at the front, gazing at the magnificent cars.
The interior was equally impressive, boasting all the essential features of a top-notch casino.
Clean, safe and accurate. Clean restrooms and friendly employees.
The square is packed with luxury cars.

originalText.text:
The casino experience was exceptional. The bustling atmosphere, combined with the elegant architecture, created a truly enchanting ambiance.
You can have endless enjoyment at the front, gazing at the magnificent cars.
The interior was equally impressive, boasting all the essential features of a top-notch casino.
Clean, safe and accurate. Clean restrooms and friendly employees.
The square is packed with luxury cars.

text.text: So luxurious, majestic, refined - just like in the movies. Expensive cars, well-dressed people and aristocratic buildings are a real treat for the eyes! Everything is sparkling clean and the surrounding gardens are beautifully maintained! It will be a great pleasure for me to return there some day.

originalText.text: So luxurious, majestic, refined - just like in the movies. Expensive cars, well-dressed people and aristocratic buildings are a real treat for the eyes! Everything is sparkling clean and the surrounding gardens are beautifully maintained! It will be a great pleasure for me to return there some day.

text.text:
We visited on Monday late evening after dinner in the Alain Ducasse across the road. Historical location and outstanding interiors.

A valid passport is required to gain entry and no other photo ID is accepted.

The casino itself was pretty average and drinks were good. We didn't stay too long and the taxi was right outside the casino after late hours.

originalText.text:
We visited on Monday late evening after dinner in the Alain Ducasse across the road. Historical location and outstanding interiors.

A valid passport is required to gain entry and no other photo ID is accepted.

The casino itself was pretty average and drinks were good. We didn't stay too long and the taxi was right outside the casino after late hours.

text.text: recently visited the Monte Carlo Casino and had a unique experience. The entry fee was 18€, which included 10€ credit for the slot machines - a fair deal to kickstart the gaming. While the casino was enjoyable, I did notice a lack of variety in gaming options. It’s important to note that the casino opens in the evening, so do check the timings before planning your visit. One of the highlights for me was the atmosphere outside the casino. The area buzzes with a fantastic vibe, enhanced by the parade of luxury cars. It’s quite a spectacle and adds to the overall charm of the place. For anyone seeking a one-of-a-kind experience in a luxurious setting, Monte Carlo Casino is definitely worth a visit.

authorAttributions.displayName: المرشد المحلي ل Google Google's local guide

editorialSummary.text: Prince of Monaco's 13th-century residence, with lavish state apartments open to public seasonally.

text.text: I didn't know about this castle until I got here and did the Formula 1 tour.  Saw this perched on the top of the mountain, we climbed the stairs and got the to the top.  Amazing view of the city and surrounding area.  You can do take a tour here and there are tons of shops/restaurants at the top.  If I had more time I would have went inside, lots of things to do around here, nice view point.

originalText.text: I didn't know about this castle until I got here and did the Formula 1 tour.  Saw this perched on the top of the mountain, we climbed the stairs and got the to the top.  Amazing view of the city and surrounding area.  You can do take a tour here and there are tons of shops/restaurants at the top.  If I had more time I would have went inside, lots of things to do around here, nice view point.

text.text: Worth a visit. The little village area is really cute, the gardens are lovely & then you get to the palace. You could probably spend 4 hours, esp if you were lucky enough to see the cars too (we didn’t have time). We spent about an hour & felt good about what we saw.

originalText.text: Worth a visit. The little village area is really cute, the gardens are lovely & then you get to the palace. You could probably spend 4 hours, esp if you were lucky enough to see the cars too (we didn’t have time). We spent about an hour & felt good about what we saw.

text.text: Just stunning to see all the restoration work. But I highly recommend getting there before noon to watch the changing of the guard. Also using the audio guide is a must to accompany you on your journey though the palaces history.

originalText.text: Just stunning to see all the restoration work. But I highly recommend getting there before noon to watch the changing of the guard. Also using the audio guide is a must to accompany you on your journey though the palaces history.

text.text:
It's Monaco.. just enjoy walking at their alleys , going through the palace..  a short visit to cathedral was worth it, then try to search some of their history (such as Grace Kelly and the Prince)
It's beautiful (especially when you're an introvert)

originalText.text:
It's Monaco.. just enjoy walking at their alleys , going through the palace..  a short visit to cathedral was worth it, then try to search some of their history (such as Grace Kelly and the Prince)
It's beautiful (especially when you're an introvert)

text.text: I expected the palace to be really beautiful because it belongs to a prince from the world's most expensive country, Monaco. However, I was disappointed because the architecture is very plain and not fancy. But if you walk around to different viewpoints, you can still enjoy beautiful views from here.

originalText.text: I expected the palace to be really beautiful because it belongs to a prince from the world's most expensive country, Monaco. However, I was disappointed because the architecture is very plain and not fancy. But if you walk around to different viewpoints, you can still enjoy beautiful views from here.

text.text: One of my best memories of our 3 week Europe trip was a day in Eze walking through narrow lanes with stone walls and flowers everywhere.  We had a tea overlooking the Mediterranean from the terrace of the Golden Goat.  I have never seen such beautifully detailed desserts as there.  We ate lunch in an open courtyard surrounded by medieval buildings.

originalText.text: One of my best memories of our 3 week Europe trip was a day in Eze walking through narrow lanes with stone walls and flowers everywhere.  We had a tea overlooking the Mediterranean from the terrace of the Golden Goat.  I have never seen such beautifully detailed desserts as there.  We ate lunch in an open courtyard surrounded by medieval buildings.

text.text: A wonderfully charming Gaelic village on top of a mountain. Definitely worth visiting this place. A bit of climbing up steep and narrow streets awaits you, but the sight is unreal. The prices of food and visiting some sights in the village are quite high, but you won't have this experience in many places. In any case, the visit to the village is free, so the advice is to at least take a walk through its streets.

originalText.text: A wonderfully charming Gaelic village on top of a mountain. Definitely worth visiting this place. A bit of climbing up steep and narrow streets awaits you, but the sight is unreal. The prices of food and visiting some sights in the village are quite high, but you won't have this experience in many places. In any case, the visit to the village is free, so the advice is to at least take a walk through its streets.

text.text: Favorite stop on my trip to the French Riviera. Beautiful old village with quaint restaurants and shops. Beautiful views around every corner. You can walk most of the village for free, if you want to go into the garden it costs money. Definitely recommend making the stop and walking these beautiful stone streets

originalText.text: Favorite stop on my trip to the French Riviera. Beautiful old village with quaint restaurants and shops. Beautiful views around every corner. You can walk most of the village for free, if you want to go into the garden it costs money. Definitely recommend making the stop and walking these beautiful stone streets

text.text: This is a place which must be on the wishlist of everybody to visit! The narrow streets, the garden on top, the small cafes and restaurants and little shops with handcrafted stuff! I do recommend!

originalText.text: This is a place which must be on the wishlist of everybody to visit! The narrow streets, the garden on top, the small cafes and restaurants and little shops with handcrafted stuff! I do recommend!

text.text:
Charming little village! Beautiful shops and views. You probably need just 2-3 hours there.

Make sure to go to the top of the village and visit the botanical gardens for spectacular views. Also, wear comfortable shoes are the walk is steep and the cobblestones are uneven at times.

originalText.text:
Charming little village! Beautiful shops and views. You probably need just 2-3 hours there.

Make sure to go to the top of the village and visit the botanical gardens for spectacular views. Also, wear comfortable shoes are the walk is steep and the cobblestones are uneven at times.

editorialSummary.text: Museum founded by navigator/oceanographer Prince Albert I, plus an aquarium with 6000 specimens.

text.text: The Oceanographic Museum of Monaco is one of those places that is recommended to be visited when you are in the principality. The museum has two lower floors and three floors above. The lower floors are the aquariums, which I would describe as the sea creatures zoo, and, irrespective of in what glamorous condition they are kept, is animal abuse in glorified clothes. The upper floors, though, were very interesting as they focused on polar exploration and the role that Monaco has played and is still playing in conserving the oceans and the environment.

originalText.text: The Oceanographic Museum of Monaco is one of those places that is recommended to be visited when you are in the principality. The museum has two lower floors and three floors above. The lower floors are the aquariums, which I would describe as the sea creatures zoo, and, irrespective of in what glamorous condition they are kept, is animal abuse in glorified clothes. The upper floors, though, were very interesting as they focused on polar exploration and the role that Monaco has played and is still playing in conserving the oceans and the environment.

text.text:
Went on a Tuesday afternoon. The aquarium is on the small side but has some interesting sea creatures. On the up floor there was a sea exploration exhibit that I wish was larger. But overall it was something to do for an hour.

It's also notable that the views are excellent.

Worth the admission fee.

originalText.text:

It's also notable that the views are excellent.

Worth the admission fee.

text.text: An absolutely amazing experience, there were so many exhibitons. I spent 2-3 hours wandering through the entire museum. Unfortunately, I went over the weekend, which was quite crowded so I'd recommended going earlier in the day or over the week. All in all, great experience, stunning views, well worth the admission price

text.text:
A great and amazing place to see amazing animals of the aquatic world and get to know the marine life.
There is a museum with wonderful exhibits, descriptions and interactive activities.
Kids will love it.

originalText.text:
A great and amazing place to see amazing animals of the aquatic world and get to know the marine life.
There is a museum with wonderful exhibits, descriptions and interactive activities.
Kids will love it.

text.text: Lovely place.  It is not the largest or most rich museum of this type, but it is really worth seeing because it has interesting specimens and an aesthetic, interesting way of presenting it.  The service was okay, the prices were not too high.  In my opinion, it is worth an hour or two for sightseeing. And there is a nice gift shop at the end - which also sells interesting books.

places.name: places/ChIJL9RBEGbDzRIRCZoqea0hC1A
places.adrFormatAddress: 20 Rue du Château, 06360 Èze, France

editorialSummary.text: This mountaintop garden featuring mostly succulents is known for its picturesque views of the ocean.

text.text: You MUST add this stunning garden to your bucket list when visiting. The views were absolutely breathtaking. The floral scents were unique and relaxing. It’s a bit of a walk up and around but I also travelled with some who have a bit of trouble on extensive walks and were able to enjoy this experience. Drink lots of water, carry with you. There’s some great dining areas along the way as well.

originalText.text: You MUST add this stunning garden to your bucket list when visiting. The views were absolutely breathtaking. The floral scents were unique and relaxing. It’s a bit of a walk up and around but I also travelled with some who have a bit of trouble on extensive walks and were able to enjoy this experience. Drink lots of water, carry with you. There’s some great dining areas along the way as well.

text.text: BEAUTIFUL garden at the top of Ezé!!! Hiked to the top after stopping in at some shops along the way- and it was well worth it! The view of the sea was spectacular and breathtaking. It was honestly so stunning and one of our top moments of our trip! There is also a mini waterfall which was cute, however not big at all. Regardless, I highly recommend coming here during your stay on the French Riviera!

originalText.text: BEAUTIFUL garden at the top of Ezé!!! Hiked to the top after stopping in at some shops along the way- and it was well worth it! The view of the sea was spectacular and breathtaking. It was honestly so stunning and one of our top moments of our trip! There is also a mini waterfall which was cute, however not big at all. Regardless, I highly recommend coming here during your stay on the French Riviera!

text.text: I have been to many botanical gardens in my life, but this one is really special how things are planted on the mountain side, having almost two separate gardens on each side, one cactus and the other of another kind, it's really worth the visit. The views from these gardens are also magnificent.

originalText.text: I have been to many botanical gardens in my life, but this one is really special how things are planted on the mountain side, having almost two separate gardens on each side, one cactus and the other of another kind, it's really worth the visit. The views from these gardens are also magnificent.

text.text: What a breathtaking location!!! You hike throughout the village and reach this highest point of the village. The southern French coastline looks beautiful from the top of this beautiful botanical garden. You can get the tickets online or from the foot of the garden, otherwise you might need to stand in the queue at the entrance.

originalText.text: What a breathtaking location!!! You hike throughout the village and reach this highest point of the village. The southern French coastline looks beautiful from the top of this beautiful botanical garden. You can get the tickets online or from the foot of the garden, otherwise you might need to stand in the queue at the entrance.

text.text:
When you get to the city, probably by bus, and you start walking up the heavily inclined road, on the right there is a virtual kiosk that you can use to buy the tickets early if you don’t want to wait in line when you get to the entrance of the park after walking for probably 30 or more minutes.

It was gorgeous! The trek up there was definitely worth it. Not only is the view beautiful, but it has many flora, sculptures, mini waterfalls, and historical info to look at.

There is drinkable water on the other side of the castle when you follow the path down if you are low on water.

The shops are very cute to look at, but are quite over priced, so beware of the trinkets that you see there.

places.name: places/ChIJfwGc-9fpzRIRJxtMa-2nlWQ
places.adrFormatAddress: 40 Av. Princesse Grace, 98000 Monaco

editorialSummary.text: Luxe beachfront hotel featuring chic eateries & a casino, plus a spa & a sand-bottomed lagoon pool.

text.text: We went for a 1 week vacation, the room had a beautiful view. We did have a few issues with the shuttle bus. The food is okay. The pool is great! But there was only 1 very small jacuzzi.

originalText.text: We went for a 1 week vacation, the room had a beautiful view. We did have a few issues with the shuttle bus. The food is okay. The pool is great! But there was only 1 very small jacuzzi.

text.text: It is a great hotel, nice, clean, all details are taken care of, the people are kind and friendly. I had a small issue with the wifi and it was solved in 5 minutes. Very nice swimming pool (indoor/outdoor). Excellent breakfast. Great view!

originalText.text: It is a great hotel, nice, clean, all details are taken care of, the people are kind and friendly. I had a small issue with the wifi and it was solved in 5 minutes. Very nice swimming pool (indoor/outdoor). Excellent breakfast. Great view!

text.text:
Firstly, if you’re traveling with kids remember: Monaco is not kids-friendly zone. Everyone is smoking and there is zero smoke-free area around the pool. To the management of the hotel: consider to stand out and introduce the smoke-free zone for families with kids on one side of the pool. Passive smoking kills - proven by science. Why do you allow passive damage of kids health in your hotel?
The rooms have great view,  yet they def need renovation. Mattress are comfortable.
Food is phenomenal in all areas.
Coffee is very poor: 10 euros for cheap, over roasted espresso from automatic chimbally machine… 20 euros for iced coffee :) For management: hire coffee consultant and level up your coffee game with specialty beans. Then you have the right to charge higher price.
Cleaning stuff on the floor (#4) is super pleasant, efficient and friendly.
The location of the hotel is great. There are few great restaurants on the beach, 7min walking distance. I will recommend this hotel if you don’t care about the disgusting smoke of cigarettes.

text.text:
Great location and service is excellent all around.

The concierge arranged our airport transfer back to the Nice airport and the driver arrived 15 mins earlier. The car is excellent and our journey was so smooth.

Porters are very helpful and called the taxi for us throughout our stays in Monta Carlo.

Our room had a comfortable king sized bed and a balcony overlooking the view of the sea and garden area which was fantastic. Facilities are good enough for a 4 starred hotel and amenities are minimum. We cant complain much.

We were authorised with a late check out but still happily to pay extra to have our room till 6pm in the evening. Thank you for accommodating us.

Beautiful venue and the restaurant on the ground floor was good but it took them a few hours to bring up the champagne back to our room and the bottle went a bit flat.

Overall, we had an excellent stay here and thank you.

text.text:
It's been a while since we were here, but I really forgot to rate you.
We were here in September 2022.
What can I say, simply, great 👍🏻 great service, stylish, very well-maintained facility despite the fact that Corona was just over at the time and everything was right!
We'll be back, definitely. LG

editorialSummary.text: Romanesque Catholic cathedral dedicated to Saint Nicholas, dating from the 19th century.

text.text: Visiting Saint Nicholas Cathedral in Monaco was a deeply enriching experience. This cathedral, also known as the Monaco Cathedral, is an architectural marvel that exudes a serene and sacred ambiance. As soon as you step inside, you are greeted by the stunning interior, which is both majestic and inviting. The history of the cathedral adds to its allure, housing the tombs of past sovereigns, including Grace Kelly and Prince Rainier III. What struck me the most was the cathedral’s peaceful atmosphere, providing a moment of tranquility amidst the bustling surroundings of Monaco. The cathedral is not only a place of worship but also a testament to the rich cultural and historical heritage of the area. Whether you are interested in history, architecture, or simply seeking a moment of peace, Saint Nicholas Cathedral is a must-visit destination in Monaco.

originalText.text: Visiting Saint Nicholas Cathedral in Monaco was a deeply enriching experience. What struck me the most was the cathedral’s peaceful atmosphere, providing a moment of tranquility amidst the bustling surroundings of Monaco. The cathedral is not only a place of worship but also a testament to the rich cultural and historical heritage of the area. Whether you are interested in history, architecture, or simply seeking a moment of peace, Saint Nicholas Cathedral is a must-visit destination in Monaco.

text.text: Beautiful architecture and rich in decorative elements inside. However I was a bit surprised to see the interior walls not being painted/plastered to elevate the design. I guess the idea was to keep the decorations standing up and more simplistic approach with the structure

originalText.text: Beautiful architecture and rich in decorative elements inside. However I was a bit surprised to see the interior walls not being painted/plastered to elevate the design. I guess the idea was to keep the decorations standing up and more simplistic approach with the structure

text.text: Went to 10:30 AM Mass in French. Saw Grace Kelly's grave in the church.  The Monte Carlo streets and sidewalks were spotless. Have your passports with you so you can get them stamped at the city hall.

originalText.text: Went to 10:30 AM Mass in French. Saw Grace Kelly's grave in the church.  The Monte Carlo streets and sidewalks were spotless. Have your passports with you so you can get them stamped at the city hall.

text.text: The architecture here is quite good, and what's even better are the fantastic viewpoints nearby.

originalText.text: The architecture here is quite good, and what's even better are the fantastic viewpoints nearby.

text.text: This beautiful cathedral was built between 1875 and 1903 on the site where there was the first parish church of Monaco, dedicated to Saint Nicholas. Here are buried some members of the Grimaldi family, including Rainier III and Grace Kelly. The place can be visited for free.

originalText.text: This beautiful cathedral was built between 1875 and 1903 on the site where there was the first parish church of Monaco, dedicated to Saint Nicholas. Here are buried some members of the Grimaldi family, including Rainier III and Grace Kelly. The place can be visited for free.

places.adrFormatAddress: 5 Av. Princesse Grace, 98000 Monaco

editorialSummary.text: Intimate garden featuring Japanese-style landscaping around a pond with a bridge & a tea house.

text.text: Amazing garden, beautifully maintained. First time visit was in 2010, it inspired my interest on Japanese gardens and the building of one at my home in Santiago de Compostela. The gardeners were very nice and we had a nice talk on the garden’s evolution and it’s maintenance, thank you for your time ❤️

originalText.text: Amazing garden, beautifully maintained. First time visit was in 2010, it inspired my interest on Japanese gardens and the building of one at my home in Santiago de Compostela. The gardeners were very nice and we had a nice talk on the garden’s evolution and it’s maintenance, thank you for your time ❤️

text.text: It's a very small garden in the form of Japanese gardens. The place is really small, and not all the areas are accessible. There is also a lot of construction going on.

originalText.text: It's a very small garden in the form of Japanese gardens. The place is really small, and not all the areas are accessible. There is also a lot of construction going on.

text.text: A great free place to explore when you are going around Monaco. It really felt like I was in Japan at some points. The only reason for 4 stars is the nearby construction which ruins the tranquility and peaceful atmosphere this park has. Still definitely worth a visit

originalText.text: A great free place to explore when you are going around Monaco. It really felt like I was in Japan at some points. The only reason for 4 stars is the nearby construction which ruins the tranquility and peaceful atmosphere this park has. Still definitely worth a visit

text.text: During my visit to Monaco, I also visited the Japanese Garden with my family, which was recommended to me by friends. A very neat and imaginative garden in the Japanese style. Cooperation with the locals is also known. Our only complaint was the guard who was extremely unfriendly. In fact, it really happened that we entered the park with a small dog in our arms. A lady at the entrance told us that having a small dog on her lap is not a problem. We realized very quickly that this was not true, as this gentleman warned us very strongly about the possible punishment. Of course, we heeded the warning and immediately sent our daughter out with our little pet. I wrote this as a warning to dog owners to avoid problems. Otherwise, the garden is nice.

text.text: Beautiful free garden. Only takes maybe 30 minutes if you really stretch your time. Very convenient too.

originalText.text: Beautiful free garden. Only takes maybe 30 minutes if you really stretch your time. Very convenient too.

places.name: places/ChIJFR5FqeHrzRIRlajTxLMHbBU
places.adrFormatAddress: Place de l'Eglise, 06500 Menton, France

editorialSummary.text: Built in 1653. this Baroque Roman Catholic basilica features artifacts & a 17th-century organ.

text.text: A short climb up the stairs will lead you to this Cathedral. While climbing up the stairs, this presents opportunities for you to capture the beach and the sea line of Menton. The orange architecture and the orange walls are also rather scenic and worth a picture. Quite a number of tourists at this scenic point.

originalText.text: A short climb up the stairs will lead you to this Cathedral. While climbing up the stairs, this presents opportunities for you to capture the beach and the sea line of Menton. The orange architecture and the orange walls are also rather scenic and worth a picture. Quite a number of tourists at this scenic point.

text.text:
The Basilica of St. Michael the Archangel was built according to the wishes of Prince Honoré II of Monaco. He wanted a "big and beautiful church to Menton" and made this wish by the Genoese architect Laurent Lavagna.
Construction began May 27, 1619, but the real work only began in 1639. In 1653 the monument was officially over and under the cult of Saint Michael the Archangel. It is May 8, 1675

originalText.text:

Construction began May 27, 1619, but the real work only began in 1639. In 1653 the monument was officially over and under the cult of Saint Michael the Archangel. It is May 8, 1675

text.text: The way leads to the Basilique is narrow and unique. And when you arrived, you will see a breathtaking view of the ocean. It's a very nice complex and peaceful too. Nice place to visit

originalText.text: The way leads to the Basilique is narrow and unique. And when you arrived, you will see a breathtaking view of the ocean. It's a very nice complex and peaceful too. Nice place to visit

text.text: So beautiful! Unfortunately it was closed when we visited, but the outside architecture and the views of the bay are absolutely stunning!

originalText.text: So beautiful! Unfortunately it was closed when we visited, but the outside architecture and the views of the bay are absolutely stunning!

text.text:
A beautiful spot with its own Micro Climate - sun every day. Right in the heart of Menton and a 2 minute walk from the beach.

I wasn't a fan if the fake sand, more gravel if you ask me, but the warm turquoise sea made up for any disappointment.

Old Town Menton is a must see...yes, even for the faint hearted. Small winding streets whose brightly coloured yellow and orange walls protected you from the blistering sun. The reward for climbing to the top...A magnificent view of the bay in its entirety and the village cascading down the hillside.

The people of Menton were super friendly appreciating those that appreciated their hard work in making thus a fabulous tourist spot.

The reward for climbing to the top...A magnificent view of the bay in its entirety and the village cascading down the hillside.

The people of Menton were super friendly appreciating those that appreciated their hard work in making thus a fabulous tourist spot.

places.formattedAddress: 15 Chem. de Passable j, 06230 Saint-Jean-Cap-Ferrat, France
places.adrFormatAddress: 15 Chem. de Passable j, 06230 Saint-Jean-Cap-Ferrat, France

editorialSummary.text: Refined spot offering Mediterranean dishes, views of the Bay of Villefranche & a beachfront lounge.

text.text: Came to the beach with my wife & son. We went to the private beach club. It has an amazing view. Beach chairs are the priciest around at $100 euro per for front row. Doesn’t include a towel. Comes with a $40 euro per chair credit. The food was really fair. Not great. Pizza was bad. The server yelled at my wife for bringing in a yeti water bottle for my 4 year old son. The servers name was Max. Then later asked me to give him a 20% tip extra. Hmmm… view is great and chairs are comfortable enough. Otherwise, just overpriced bad food.

originalText.text: Came to the beach with my wife & son. We went to the private beach club. It has an amazing view. Beach chairs are the priciest around at $100 euro per for front row. Doesn’t include a towel. Comes with a $40 euro per chair credit. The food was really fair. Not great. Pizza was bad. The server yelled at my wife for bringing in a yeti water bottle for my 4 year old son. The servers name was Max. Then later asked me to give him a 20% tip extra. Hmmm… view is great and chairs are comfortable enough. Otherwise, just overpriced bad food.

text.text: We visited the public part of this beach during the afternoon. It has a small shop with ice creams and sodas. Be notified of the beach club that plays music just beside of the beach. Luckily for us it was a good dj playing some nice old school disco music.

originalText.text: We visited the public part of this beach during the afternoon. It has a small shop with ice creams and sodas. Be notified of the beach club that plays music just beside of the beach. Luckily for us it was a good dj playing some nice old school disco music.

text.text: lovely experience. Came September 1st (not during the peak season) and loved it. It is worth the price to pay to get a sunbed and enjoy the water. Highly recommend it. And there is a restaurant as well which is a huge plus. Ordered tons of appetizers and mains to share.

originalText.text: lovely experience. Came September 1st (not during the peak season) and loved it. It is worth the price to pay to get a sunbed and enjoy the water. Highly recommend it. And there is a restaurant as well which is a huge plus. Ordered tons of appetizers and mains to share.

text.text:
I happened upon this beach in mid-November while hiking the coast of St. Jean Cap Ferrat. The beach club was shacked up for the winter and the beach was all but deserted. Still, I would imagine it looks beautiful in the summer, with open sea in front of a small pebbly beach.

It's quite secluded.

It's quite secluded.

text.text:
It is small, crowded, not clean and the service is so-so, considering  high prices ….
Sea 🌊 swim and its colors are incredible though and views of villas and of a harbor are very beautiful. Worth for once

editorialSummary.text: High-end sporty yacht club established by Prince Rainier III in 1953 with around 2,000 members.

text.text: Monaco Ville is a beautiful high society hotspot and everyone should visit it at least once. People are friendly, stores are great and restaurants as well. But it is also perfect if you just want to relax...

originalText.text: Monaco Ville is a beautiful high society hotspot and everyone should visit it at least once. People are friendly, stores are great and restaurants as well. But it is also perfect if you just want to relax...

text.text: The Club is always welcoming and impeccably kept. It combines the best of tradition with a modern day friendly experience. The kitchen/food is always an outstanding experience, matched by their equally outstanding sense of hospitality.

originalText.text: The Club is always welcoming and impeccably kept. It combines the best of tradition with a modern day friendly experience. The kitchen/food is always an outstanding experience, matched by their equally outstanding sense of hospitality.

text.text: Delicious food with great à la carte options, as well as a great buffet. Amazing service with great drinks options (alcoholic as well as non-alcoholic). Beautiful setting and location and gorgeous view onto the port and the sea.

originalText.text: Delicious food with great à la carte options, as well as a great buffet. Amazing service with great drinks options (alcoholic as well as non-alcoholic). Beautiful setting and location and gorgeous view onto the port and the sea.

text.text: Amazing place for memorable moments. Club feeling, events, dining, and sports.

originalText.text: Amazing place for memorable moments. Club feeling, events, dining, and sports.

text.text:
Beautiful architecture that suits the Hercules Port of Monaco.Since it is a private club  ,you need to be invited.
Upon invitation we sat in the open restaurant, loud old music, amateur servers,but the BBQ was generous.

originalText.text:
Beautiful architecture that suits the Hercules Port of Monaco.Since it is a private club  ,you need to be invited.
Upon invitation we sat in the open restaurant, loud old music, amateur servers,but the BBQ was generous.

editorialSummary.text: Picturesque 19th-century botanical garden noted for its exotic trees & pond with aquatic plants.

text.text: Menton's botanical garden is a delightful family-friendly spot, perfect for quality time. The garden not only boasts scenic beauty but also practical amenities like well-marked paths, a convenient restroom, and a mini shop offering water and snacks. The friendly reception staff adds a welcoming touch, and with discounts for those under 23, it becomes an even more appealing destination. A solid five-star rating for this well-rounded facility.

originalText.text: Menton's botanical garden is a delightful family-friendly spot, perfect for quality time. The garden not only boasts scenic beauty but also practical amenities like well-marked paths, a convenient restroom, and a mini shop offering water and snacks. The friendly reception staff adds a welcoming touch, and with discounts for those under 23, it becomes an even more appealing destination. A solid five-star rating for this well-rounded facility.

text.text: Magnificent garden with very friendly stuff at entery. We visited it in October and followed the path which was presented to us by stuff and it was beautiful experience. There is a lot of beautiful trees and flowers from all around the world. It's really close to the old part of the town by foot. You shouldn't miss visiting it when in Menton.

originalText.text: Magnificent garden with very friendly stuff at entery. We visited it in October and followed the path which was presented to us by stuff and it was beautiful experience. There is a lot of beautiful trees and flowers from all around the world. It's really close to the old part of the town by foot. You shouldn't miss visiting it when in Menton.

text.text:
Beautiful gardens which are a delight to explore.
They also provide mosquito repellent - make use of it!

originalText.text:
Beautiful gardens which are a delight to explore.
They also provide mosquito repellent - make use of it!

text.text:
Mid May. Thunder threatened skies. Lush subtropical plants bursting into flower. A wonderful garden just to admire and a botanical treasure chest for me. All neatly labelled and with informative signage that if you scan the QR code gives an audio English translation.
Wonderfully impressive bamboo, palms and figs tower over flowering plants, many new to me.
€7 entrance includes a little museum. And you can get hot and cold drinks too. Highly recommended.

originalText.text:
Mid May. Thunder threatened skies. Lush subtropical plants bursting into flower. A wonderful garden just to admire and a botanical treasure chest for me. All neatly labelled and with informative signage that if you scan the QR code gives an audio English translation.
Wonderfully impressive bamboo, palms and figs tower over flowering plants, many new to me.
€7 entrance includes a little museum. And you can get hot and cold drinks too. Highly recommended.

text.text:
Not a large garden but still a nice and peaceful place to sit and soak in nature. A whole walk could take around 30mins if you follow the numbered stops. Visited on a Thursday after lunch and there were only 3-4 other visitors.

A part of the main building was under renovation on 11 May. I don’t know when it will be completed but I think it’s best to visit when the reno is done so that you can admire the buildings in full.

Ticket purchase was very easy as the friendly staff was able to speak english and there are English maps as well.

It was very nice to see the mandarin and lemon trees. I also liked the cotton tree that is beside the lily pond and the different varieties on bamboos.

Overall the garden is a nice pit stop if you have time to kill and there are nice lil photo areas, but the garden is also quite an elevated uphill climb of around 15mins 🤭

originalText.text:

text.text: A hidden castle with amazing view, you must see it! From the parking places only a 5 min. walk.

originalText.text: A hidden castle with amazing view, you must see it! From the parking places only a 5 min. walk.

text.text: Interesting castle in the center of a medieval village with views from Monaco to Menton. It is 5 euros per entry and you can explore inside the castle with some descriptions of the rooms in many languages. There are winding steps that take you to different corners of the castle and some parts are closed off. It isn't a very large castle but I would recommend it if you're in the area. The entire area around the castle is lovely to walk and explore, too. Awesome bathroom too

originalText.text: Interesting castle in the center of a medieval village with views from Monaco to Menton. The entire area around the castle is lovely to walk and explore, too. Awesome bathroom too

text.text: The castle itself is not so big from the inside, but the view is amazing from everywhere! Be ready for climbing (stairs), especially on the way up to the castle!

originalText.text: The castle itself is not so big from the inside, but the view is amazing from everywhere! Be ready for climbing (stairs), especially on the way up to the castle!

text.text: Beautiful little castle with amazing views. Staff not so friendly, heard us coming and closed the door to take a 5 min break 🤦 but other than that great, worth the 5 euro entry, closes at 5pm so be aware of the time as at 4:30 they already refused letting people in

text.text:
Not far from Menton, about 6 km head up north to the mountains. there is a fantastic castle with a wonderful view.  The castle is accessible by car and only the last 500 m you must walk up by stairs.
It is worth to visiting even they charge you 5,-€ 😉👍

editorialSummary.text: Fancy, late-night casino featuring many slot machines, 2 outdoor patios & table games.

text.text:
Cafe de Paris Monte-Carlo is an epitome of culinary excellence, exuding the charm of Belle Époque glamour and offering an unforgettable dining experience. Situated at the heart of Monaco, the restaurant's breathtaking location captivates visitors, providing a front-row seat to the vibrant life of the city. From the moment you step in, you are enveloped in an atmosphere of elegance and sophistication, accentuated by impeccable service.

The gastronomic journey begins with a tantalizing selection of Mediterranean cuisine, exquisitely prepared and presented with an artistic touch. Each dish is a masterful blend of flavors, showcasing the finest ingredients and culinary expertise. The extensive menu caters to diverse palates, ensuring that every visitor finds their perfect culinary match.

A great place also to enjoy a good cigar and considering all the above I can say is reasonably priced!

A great place also to enjoy a good cigar and considering all the above I can say is reasonably priced!

text.text: A bucket list you must tick off since their recent move to the Hotel De Paris Grand Ballroom. The service was absolutely 6 stars. The presentation and the taste was beyond. Go here hungry. Leave with stars in your eyes.

originalText.text: A bucket list you must tick off since their recent move to the Hotel De Paris Grand Ballroom. The service was absolutely 6 stars. The presentation and the taste was beyond. Go here hungry. Leave with stars in your eyes.

text.text: Café de Paris in Monte Carlo, a culinary jewel on the French Riviera, enchants with its al-fresco charm. A gastronomic haven where delectable dishes meet vibrant street scenes. The iconic café is a rendezvous for indulgent moments, offering a perfect blend of classic elegance and the lively pulse of Monte Carlo. From people-watching to savoring exquisite cuisine, it's a must-visit oasis where the essence of the Côte d'Azur comes alive with every sip and bite.

The iconic café is a rendezvous for indulgent moments, offering a perfect blend of classic elegance and the lively pulse of Monte Carlo. From people-watching to savoring exquisite cuisine, it's a must-visit oasis where the essence of the Côte d'Azur comes alive with every sip and bite.

text.text: Worth the visit, iconic as expected, definitely worth booking the terrace to make the most of the setting. Food was ok, not extraordinary but as expected - good and traditional.

originalText.text: Worth the visit, iconic as expected, definitely worth booking the terrace to make the most of the setting. Food was ok, not extraordinary but as expected - good and traditional.

text.text: Beautiful art deco restaurant backed up by delightful and charming wait staff.

originalText.text: Beautiful art deco restaurant backed up by delightful and charming wait staff.

editorialSummary.text: Early 1900s copy of a classical Greek villa, featuring antique-filled interiors & Cap Ferrat views.

text.text:
You’ll be amazed by the physics knowledge and structural concept of this Ancient Greek Revival style mansion.

The detailed mosaics and color matching unimaginable until you admire it in person.

I personally love its library/study room. A must-see tourist spot when you’re in Beaulieu Sur Mer area.

The detailed mosaics and color matching unimaginable until you admire it in person.

I personally love its library/study room. A must-see tourist spot when you’re in Beaulieu Sur Mer area.

text.text: Truly amazing place; more intimate villa than a more famous sister Rotchild Ephroussi. The level of architectural detail is just mind- blowing. This coupled with mesmerizing ambiance of the sea waves and exotic garden makes a perfect little evening visit.

originalText.text: Truly amazing place; more intimate villa than a more famous sister Rotchild Ephroussi. The level of architectural detail is just mind- blowing. This coupled with mesmerizing ambiance of the sea waves and exotic garden makes a perfect little evening visit.

Simply magnificent!

But be aware: it closes at 17h, not at 18h (as mentioned in google maps)

places.adrFormatAddress: 22 Av. Princesse Grace, 98000 Monaco

text.text: It’s just like in the race! Who would’ve thought. Wait around here for a while if it’s nice out and you’ll see some nice cars sending it up or down the hill F1 style, well almost except at 1/4 the speed. If you’re not walking the full track there’s an F1 statue down the hill right after the hairpin as well.

If you’re not walking the full track there’s an F1 statue down the hill right after the hairpin as well.

text.text: As iconic as you would hope and expect. Highly recommend a room at the Fairmont Monte Carlo to take in the turn and car/people watch.

originalText.text: As iconic as you would hope and expect. Highly recommend a room at the Fairmont Monte Carlo to take in the turn and car/people watch.

text.text: Iconic corner that almost always has some F1 fans visiting. Makes for great photos, especially at night when all of Monaco is lit up.

originalText.text: Iconic corner that almost always has some F1 fans visiting. Makes for great photos, especially at night when all of Monaco is lit up.

text.text: Nice to see the actual spot but if you want to see nice sport cars you will have to wait and be patient. We've seen a lot of "normal, everyday" cars and only a couple cars you can rarely see elsewhere. Visited on friday at noon.

originalText.text: Nice to see the actual spot but if you want to see nice sport cars you will have to wait and be patient. We've seen a lot of "normal, everyday" cars and only a couple cars you can rarely see elsewhere. Visited on friday at noon.

text.text: Cool spot to visit for F1 fans, great to walk part of the track up close.

originalText.text: Cool spot to visit for F1 fans, great to walk part of the track up close.

text.text:
Ambience is eye catching right away. It gives me the vibes of Tao night club in Vegas with a big Buddh Statue. It is nicely decorated inside is spacious. I could give the place 6 stars if I could. It’s beautiful and is a great place to get together for drinking or just having that date with special someone.
The food was ok to me. I got the modern California rolls which I thought was good. The shrimp with red Thai spicy curry was a but salty to me because it wasn’t served with rice, and drank the curry soup and it was salty. The shrimp would have been a little better if it wasn’t too breaking a part too much. Other than that, the taste was good, just a bit on the saly side.
Got the Wok fried beef with Thai basil, along with some sesame noodles. Ok, noodles were cooked right, soft and not starchy, but my beef was just wayyyy to salty in my opinion. Dont get me wrong, the taste is good, if only the chef went easy on the salt then it would be perfect. Im a person that eats really salty food, my food has to be flavorful, and I can drink fish sauce.. but if I can’t even try to finish, then it was not made for my palate. Service was excellent. Food came out all together at once very quickly per our request. Music was played just right, not too loud. Overall, nice experience. I would come back again to try the rest of the menus.

Food came out all together at once very quickly per our request. Music was played just right, not too loud. Overall, nice experience. I would come back again to try the rest of the menus.

text.text:
The atmosphere is the biggest selling point! Service is good, food is good, but I think best for drinks to enjoy the space and then dinner elsewhere.

Walking in, you’re immediately wowed by the lighting, decor, and lounge style seating. The staff are very friendly and helpful, greeting you and helping you get seated. I came in solo without a reservation and easily got a seat at the bar.

Cocktails are very good but expensive (this is Monte Carlo after all). Definitely worth the splurge for a signature cocktail though, in my opinion.

I ordered two appetizers - the calamari and the chicken gyoza with truffle sauce. The gyoza were delicious; perfectly thin wrappers and very flavorful. The sauce went with them beautifully. The calamari was average. A bit too chewy, and the sauce leaned a bit too acidic.

This place is definitely worth a visit for the WOW factor and some great cocktails!

originalText.text:
The atmosphere is the biggest selling point! Service is good, food is good, but I think best for drinks to enjoy the space and then dinner elsewhere.

I ordered two appetizers - the calamari and the chicken gyoza with truffle sauce. The gyoza were delicious; perfectly thin wrappers and very flavorful. The sauce went with them beautifully. The calamari was average. A bit too chewy, and the sauce leaned a bit too acidic.

This place is definitely worth a visit for the WOW factor and some great cocktails!

text.text:
I have no words for this place, it is stunning! The drinks and cocktails have really good taste and so much to choose from. The bartenders are smiley and very talkative and you can see that they enjoy what they are doing.

The vibes from the people, the stunning interior... I really recommend! Make sure you make a reservation online cause it would be hard to get in without one.

text.text:
The Best Dining Experience in Monaco!
Amazing food and exceptional atmosphere!

Live DJ, fresh made to order sushi 🍣 and incredible ambiance. It is located in the heart of Monaco at the end of the casino.

Reservations were easy to make via the website. Arrived and was promptly seated without further wait times.
The staff offered extensive knowledge of menu options.

Outside bar area for before/after dinner beverages was also lively and impressive.
Highly recommended for anyone traveling to Monaco.

The staff offered extensive knowledge of menu options.

Outside bar area for before/after dinner beverages was also lively and impressive.
Highly recommended for anyone traveling to Monaco.

text.text: It's our second visit to Buddha-Bar Monte-Carlo. Atmosphere and service were good as always. Tried many dishes. My favorites are crispy shrimp sushi, rock shrimp tempura, black cod and Buddha-Bar fried Noodles. They have a large selection of cocktails. I recommend the golden mule. The dessert menu could have more options.

The dessert menu could have more options.

editorialSummary.text: Monaco's casino & upscale restaurants surround this well-known plaza that is home to live events.

text.text: Too many people. Strange mirror dish in center looks out of place. Casino itself looks cheaper and smaller than you may think. Looks more like railway station. Nothing like James Bond movies. Plastic wrap on carpet at entrance was very luxury.

originalText.text: Too many people. Strange mirror dish in center looks out of place. Casino itself looks cheaper and smaller than you may think. Looks more like railway station. Nothing like James Bond movies. Plastic wrap on carpet at entrance was very luxury.

text.text: The casino is like a fancy palace, and it's okay-ish. You have to pay to go in, and there are rules about how you should dress. When I put up a tripod to take pictures outside, a security guard quickly told me to take it down.

originalText.text: The casino is like a fancy palace, and it's okay-ish. You have to pay to go in, and there are rules about how you should dress. When I put up a tripod to take pictures outside, a security guard quickly told me to take it down.

text.text: We visited the square infront of the famous Monte Carlo casino and left a bit dissapointed. The roundabout is a walking zone and only a few of the "nice sport cars" were parked so actually nothing much to see. Took a picture and moved on behind the casino for the sea view and famous soccer hand/footprints and signatures.

text.text:
Best and magic time of the year in Monaco!

In Dickens' 'A Christmas Carol,' he emphasizes the importance of humanity, compassion, and kindness towards others. He highlights universal values of humanity that transcend religious boundaries, emphasizing the significance of compassion and aiding others."

text.text:
Title: "Elegance and Entertainment at Place du Casino"

Review:
Place du Casino in Monaco is a captivating blend of luxury and entertainment. The iconic Casino de Monte-Carlo and upscale restaurants surround this plaza, creating an atmosphere of sophistication. Live events add vibrancy, making it a must-visit destination for an extraordinary experience in the heart of Monaco.

places.formattedAddress: plateau saint-michel, Rte des Ciappes de Castellar, 06500 Menton, France
places.adrFormatAddress: plateau saint-michel, Rte des Ciappes de Castellar, 06500 Menton, France

displayName.text: Campsites French Riviera Menton - St Michel

places.shortFormattedAddress: plateau saint-michel, Rte des Ciappes de Castellar, Menton

editorialSummary.text: Modest hillside campground with ocean views offering tent & caravan sites, plus cabin rentals.

text.text: This is a nice campsite with great views, very clean amenities and friendly staff. However there are some issues! First is that there are only a small number of showers and toilets for a site of this size. Secondly these facilities and the site generally is looking very tired and needs a significant overhaul. Finally the price is way too high for the quality of the amenities here. We have stayed in places half this price that are better serviced. The route in is challenging which ever way you choose - best avoided if you have a large van. Steps up and down to town do make you very fit! Access to the train station is great for visiting other towns and Menton is lovely.

text.text:
Just lovely, so romantical & quiet place uphill 100+m over the beautiful Menton. 💖
The sea - awesome, even at the city beach (what I usually avoid) People - too! 💖
The price could be a little bit lower...
Wished to stay forever!

originalText.text:
Just lovely, so romantical & quiet place uphill 100+m over the beautiful Menton. 💖
The sea - awesome, even at the city beach (what I usually avoid) People - too! 💖
The price could be a little bit lower...
Wished to stay forever!

text.text: Friendly staff. Nice camping spots woth some shade, but there are gravel and hard pressed soil instead of grass = more ants around and inside the tent. VERY expensive compared to other campings here, 47 Euro for one night 2 adults, 2 kids and a tent, without electricity. The gates closes at 10 pm, so after that you can't access your camping spot with car. Only 2 toilettes for the whole camping, but they are clean. No paper on the toilettes "due to covid restrictions", still. The dish wash sink gives only burning hot water (2 seconds, then you have to press the button again) and you can't lower the temperature. Unfortunately no other campings around.

No paper on the toilettes "due to covid restrictions", still. The dish wash sink gives only burning hot water (2 seconds, then you have to press the button again) and you can't lower the temperature. Unfortunately no other campings around.

text.text:
Difficult to access the site, even using the recommended route. Views are spectacular but very difficult to access the town, and coming back up 300+ steps is not for the faint hearted. 2 sets of sanitaires we were closest to the more updated block, but it was something of a trek, especially if you need to go to the loo during the night. Decent restaurant next door to the site for meat eaters, but no fish or vegetarian options.
Not the worst site, but I wouldn’t be rushing back especially at these prices.

text.text:
We absolutely loved this campsite!
The drive up through town was a little hair raising, so try and come around the back way if you have a bigger camper. If you come through Menton there is a few hair pin turns on a steep slope.

On arrival and for the whole stay the staff were very helpful and friendly! We were given a full intro to the camp, what was where, how to order breakfast and get into town. The showers and toilet were clean and comfortable. The views are amazing and it’s pure tranquility up there!

It’s around 10 mins walk from Menton back up to the campsite up steep steps so keep this in mind.

Our favorite campsite along the Rivera!

P.s the pizzeria next to the campsite is absolutely amazing for views and pizza! A real hidden gem! Staff lovely here too!

editorialSummary.text: Upscale hot spot with finger foods & a bar, plus DJs, late hours & a covered outdoor terrace.

text.text: They have great music, and overall it’s a nice, lively atmosphere. If you want a table, you can reserve one in the VIP area beforehand or it’s on a first come first serve basis. I always take my friends here and everyone loves it.

originalText.text: They have great music, and overall it’s a nice, lively atmosphere. If you want a table, you can reserve one in the VIP area beforehand or it’s on a first come first serve basis. I always take my friends here and everyone loves it.

text.text:
Club in Monaco 🇲🇨
The club is fine, big (2 floors) they make you pay the entrance (which wasn’t the case before) which is a shame and drinks can be a bit expensive

originalText.text:

text.text: The famous La Rascasse corner on the Monaco Grand Prix track. The corner runs along the harbour and behind it is the entrance to the pits. It’s a great place to watch the F1 but very expensive. On non Grand Prix track times it’s a regular bar with music and dancing which anyone can visit.

It’s a great place to watch the F1 but very expensive. On non Grand Prix track times it’s a regular bar with music and dancing which anyone can visit.

text.text: A very cosy place with live music and delicious food.

originalText.text: A very cosy place with live music and delicious food.

text.text: Nice disco bar for a night out in Monaco at a reasonable price. Quick and nice service and good music. The space for dancing is a bit limited, especially if there are a lot of people, but it's okay
